name: tfrmt
description: The {tfrmt} R package is a table formatting framework that provides the means to flexibly design and build mock results summaries.

name: Digital Data Flow
description: The DDF initiative aims to modernize clinical trials by enabling a digital workflow that allows for automated creation of study content and configuration of study systems to support clinical trial execution.

name: tidyCDISC
description: tidyCDISC is a shiny app to easily create custom tables and figures from ADaM-ish data sets.

name: Admiral
description: ADaM in R Asset Library.

name: odmlib
description: odmlib is a Python library that simplifies creating and processing ODM and its extensions, such as Define-XML.

name: Tplyr
description: Tplyr is a grammar of data format and summary, designed to simplify the creation of clinical safety summaries.

name: OpenStudyBuilder
description: The OpenStudyBuilder is a new approach to working with studies that once fully implemented will drive end-to-end consistency and more efficient processes.

name: Define-XML XSL Stylesheets
description: This projects provides a Define-XML v2.0 and v2.1 XSL stylesheet

name: R4DSXML
description: R4DSXML is R package for import both CDISC Dataset-XML and Define-XML as R data frame.

name: Smart Submission Dataset Viewer
description: Dataset viewer allowing to inspect CDISC SDTM, SEND and ADaM submission files.

name: Visual Define-XML Editor
description: Visual Editor for Define-XML 2.0 and ARM standards.

name: CDISC Rules Engine (CORE)
description: Deliver and execute a governed set of executable Conformance Rules for each Foundational Standard

name: CORE - Rule Editor
description: Creating additional Conformance Rules in a common specification for CORE

name: openCST
description: The open-source release of the SAS Clinical Standards Toolkit (openCST) is a framework that allows for the registration of CDISC standards metadata to enable automation, such as working in SAS with XML based standards (Define-XML, ODM, ...) and validation of clinical data, such as SDTM.

name: defineR
description: An open-source R package capable of generating the Define-XML.

name: CDISC-ODM-XML-CRF-SDTM-Annotations
description: An XMLMAP for ODM-XML and for Define-XML along with a  small set of SAS macros for each, converting the XML documents to SAS datasets following familiar data models shared by MDR and validation tools.

name: ODM XML Stylesheet
description: Apply a style sheet to ODM-XML, exactly as you apply a style sheet to define-xml to display it in a browser.

name: Dataset-JSON R Package Implementation
description: Read and write Dataset-JSON files in R.

name: Dataset-JSON SAS Implementation
description: This project provides support for reading, writing, and validating Dataset-JSON files in a SAS environment.

name: CDISC Library Client
description: Provide a way to make api calls to CDISC Library without having to develop any boilerplate code for connecting to the library.

name: carver
description: carver is an R package that helps develop Tables and Figures from CDISC-standard ADaM datasets.

name: ramnog
description: Ramnog is an R-package to support the requirements according the German AMNOG process

name: Study Definitions Workbench (SDW)
description: The Study Definitions Workbench provides a set of tools to assist users and developers in adopting USDM, M11 and the associated FHIR messages. It will alos bring together some of the early tooling develop to show the USDM into one place.

name: sdtm.oak
description: {sdtm.oak} is an EDC (Electronic Data Capture systems) and Data Standard agnostic solution that enables the pharmaceutical programming community to develop CDISC (Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium) SDTM (Study Data Tabulation Model) datasets in R.

name: gtsummary
description: The {gtsummary} project makes is simple to create summary tables directly from an ADaM data set, or from an Analysis Result Dataset (ARD; part of the Analysis Results Standard). When users create tables directly from ADaM data sets, they are able to extract an ARD from the table object.

name: cards
description: The {cards} R package is a tool to create ARDs. The package also includes many utilities to assist users in creating ARDs for bespoke statistical analyses.

name: cardx
description: The {cardx} R package is a tool that builds on the {cards} project to create ARDs for simple and complex statistical methods.

name: siera
description: siera produces fully automated R programs from ARS metadata, ready to be run to generate ARDs from relevant ADaM datasets.

name: HandyCT
description: HandyCT is a point-and-click R Shiny web application that integrates with CDISC API to provide easy access to control terminologies with minimal effort.

name: USDM to SDTM TS domains
description: This applicaiton processes jsonata commands with a USDM JSON file to generate the corresponding data items.
